author: schone_wizard
content: what day+time is the call regarding take-aways from EIP-1559/London HF?

author: timbeiko
content:
If anyone wants to analyze this, it feels like the recent spike of the base fee we had was processed *extremely* efficiently: we went from ~40 to ~1750 to ~80 all in ~100 blocks. It would be super interesting to compare how quickly we get through different magnitudes of base fee increases vs. pre-london when we had massive gas price increases (which often lasted hours). 

Just by virtue of adding more blockspace, you'd expect 1559 to yield a 2x improvement, but my gut feel is that we're probably seeing much more than that.

author: timbeiko
content: In other words, how long did the average 2x/5x/10x increase in gas price last pre-London and now?

author: timbeiko
content: Obivously, not a perfect measure because the amount of demand matters, but IMO this is "smoothed out" by (1) the size of the spike and (2) averaging over multiple spikes.
